action.action-desc: Mrs. McBath (for herself, Mrs. McClain, Mr. Levin of Michigan, and Mrs. Miller-Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to require the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a publicly available database of bid solicitations for infant formula under the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the WIC Healthy Beginnings Act of 2022.

section.header: Database of bid solicitations for infant formula under the WIC program
section.text: Section 17(h)(8)(A) of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1786(h)(8)(A)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this clause, the Secretary shall make available to the public the information described in items (aa) through (dd) of subclause (II) relating to bid solicitations of State agencies for infant formula under the program.

In soliciting bids for infant formula under the program, a State agency, or a State agency on behalf of a State alliance, shall submit to the Secretary, not later than 5 business days after the date when the bid solicitation is made available online to bidders by the State, a description of the bid solicitation, includingâ€”

item.text: the title of the bid solicitation and the State agency administering the bid solicitation if not available via the website hyperlink;
the website hyperlink and other information needed for the purpose of submitting a bid in response to the bid solicitation if not available via the website hyperlink;
the contact information and website hyperlink for the State agency administering the bid solicitation, for the purpose of gathering additional information relating to the bid solicitation; and
the period during which bids are accepted or the due date for bids, as applicable, under the bid solicitation.

subclause.text: Not later than 10 days after receiving a description of a bid solicitation under subclause (II), the Secretary shall publish the information on the database established under subclause (I).
The Secretary shall issue guidance to implement this clause.

A State, State agency, or the Federal Government shall not be liable in a civil suit or claim in a State or Federal court based on the performance or failure to perform a duty, function, or activity required by this clause.
